metadata.title: CVE-2020-15666 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Compliant (bionic) - low
metadata.description:
When trying to load a non-video in an audio/video context the exact statuscode (200, 302, 404, 500, 412, 403, etc.) was disclosed via the MediaErrorMessage. This level of information leakage is inconsistent with thestandardized onerror/onsuccess disclosure and can lead to inferring loginstatus to services or device discovery on a local network among otherattacks. This vulnerability affects Firefox < 80 and Firefox for Android <80.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-15666` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 80.0+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
firefox-geckodriver - 80.0+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
firefox-mozsymbols - 80.0+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: firefox package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '80.0+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.1').
mozjs38: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
mozjs52: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
